answers.author: Ernest Pages
answers.text:
Kevin,
some vendors that provide that type of software include, Cartegraph (Map based system) and Comcate (primarily for code enforcement).
Good luck on your search.
Ernest

answers.author: Jeffrey Howell
answers.text:
We use Cartegraph for public works type work and PTWin32 by BlackBear Systems for Code Enforcement and Building related services

answers.author: Sylvia Carrillo
answers.text:
We (Corpus Christi, Texas) use SunGard (or Naviline) cheap but reliable system. Not very "pretty" but if you are willing to pay, they can make it "pretty". They go under the name SunGard Public Service and are based out of Florida.

answers.author: Derek VanSchmus
answers.text:
We use Cartegraph for street, signal and sign maintenance. We are exploring options for migrating to a single system for all Public Works activities, so would be glad to hear of additional options so thanks to all for thequestion and responses.


We use Cartegraph for street, signal and sign maintenance. We are exploring options for migrating to a single system for all Public Works activities, so would be glad to hear of additional options so thanks to all for thequestion and responses.

answers.author: Pam Broviak
answers.text:
Our city currently uses WebQA, but this is web-based. I had a bad experience with Cartegraph at the last city where I worked - if you are considering them, I am willing to discuss the issues offline (630-232-1501).

author: Kevin Helms
text: Does anyone know of a simple program that can be used to issue service orders for public works and building codes?  I am looking for something that you purchase and use in house that is not web based.
title: Software Search
